availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Patrick White, Jr. (Hamilton County, Ohio, laborer)

body.p: Cincinnati, Hamilton County, Ohio, laborer. Native of Ireland. Son of Patrick White and Nancy Ann White. Resident of Cincinnati, Hamilton County, Ohio, in 1850. Laborer in Cincinnati in 1860. Convicted of the rape of Elizabeth Franklin in Campbell County, Kentucky, on February 12, 1862. Pardoned by Governor Thomas Bramlette on April 21, 1864.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Ohio, Hamilton County, Cincinnati Ward 4, p. 199A.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Ohio, Hamilton County, Cincinnati Ward 3, p. 180.
"Convicted," Cincinnati Enquirer (Cincinnati, OH), Feb. 13, 1862.
KYR-0001-029-0195.
